intro: Eremocallis cinerea, commonly known as the silverstem daylily, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern North America. It features tall, sturdy stems that are covered in a silvery-gray bloom, giving it its common name. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow to orange, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Eremocallis cinerea is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often used in gardens for its long-lasting blooms.
